intro: Sterigmostemum regeliorum, commonly known as the Regel's stemless plant, is a rare and unusual member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its lack of a distinct stem, with the leaves directly emerging from the root system. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its botanical structure is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system for water absorption. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
